connector.description: Send data to a MariaDB Database. This Kamelet expects a JSON-formatted body. Use key:value pairs to map the JSON fields and parameters.

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverName.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverName
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverName.description: The server name for the data source. Example: localhost

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverPort.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverPort
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverPort.description: The server port for the data source.

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.username.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.username
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.username.description: The username to access a secured MariaDB Database.

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.password.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.password
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.password.description: The password to access a secured MariaDB Database.

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.query.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.query
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.query.description: The query to execute against the MariaDB Database. Example: INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.databaseName.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.databaseName
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.databaseName.description: The name of the MariaDB Database.
